lines.text: [the Jewel is woken up by Joan chipping away at the bars of their cell with a two-by-four plank]
What are you doing?
In my last novel, 'Angelina and the Savage Secret' Angelina used a nail file to chip away at the bars of her cell to remove them and escape to freedom.
How long did this take?
Two pages.
Jack is dead.
Don't be ridiculous! Jack would never die without telling me.
Nevertheless, he's dead.
We are sworn, Just Joan.
Right, but it's just "Joan."
Right - Just Joan.

You're all I thought about for six months. They threw me in a jail filled with rejects from the communicable disease ward. Every wacko, drippy, open-sored low-life was in that joint, all of them wanting to hire on as my proctologist.
[Jack, Joan, and the Jewel are being shot at]
Do not worry. I'm sure it's not my destiny to die on this mountain.
What about us?

[pause]
That's another ball game.
Come on, Colton! Where's the jewel?
Ralph, I am the Jewel. The Jewel of the Nile.
Yeah, and I'm a kumquat from Queens! Pipe down, towel-head!
[Omar has put Jack and Joan in a deathtrap copied from one of Joan's own books]
So how'd they get out?
What?
In "The Savage Secret".
Oh. Um... Jesse had a knife hidden in his boot. You wouldn't happen to have a knife, would you?
I'm not even wearing underwear.
You know, I'll bet you can buy a great townhouse down here for around five or six dollars.
Jack!
Hold tight, I'm coming!
I thought you said you wanted to sail around the world with me?
Well, I do, but, but not all of it this week. I mean, Jack, this is just becoming a blur. Exotic ports. And great parties. And spectacular sunsets. It's not enough.
How much romance can one woman take?
Literary functions are not exactly Jack's speed. I mean, the guy's favorite author is the man who wrote "Pull tab to open".
My heart just isn't in it. I mean, romance just doesn't seem real to me anymore.
Real? You don't write real - you write about people that sail off into the god damn sunset.
Well, what about the next day, when the sun comes up?
There is no next day! That's why it's a romance. You've got to stop confusing real life with a romantic novel!
I read about you.
Yes. I know, Time magazine. Well, I'm afraid the western press cannot understand the spirit of my vision. You are a writer. You can understand.
You are a gifted storyteller. You create heroes in a world of cynics. Journey down the Nile with me and I'll give you a chance to record history.
I'm sorry you had such a tough time. Ah, how 'bout a hundred bucks?
A hundred bucks? I'll give you a one-way ticket to harp land. No more jokes! What'd you do with it?
What are you talkin' about?
The stone, moron!
You're woman is in danger too. I will take you to him.
I'm comin' too!
The hell you are!
Look, you owe me Colton. So, where ever you're going, I'm going. Where we going?
Why do these third world cesspools always got to be so hot? Will you tell me that?
I got to get off of this camel. It's breakin' my ass!
Here! You are welcome! We have food. We have drink!
You gotta toilet?
Ah, what's that I hear? A heart breaking? You sap! Better keep your mind on business, Romeo, you'll wind up gettin' yourself killed over some broad who dumped you.
You are guests of Omar. Find for us the jewel. Accept your destiny!
Destiny, my ass.
You hook up with a bunch of juju beads, you see what happens?
Just take you're lead from me and you'll be fine.
What are we going to do? Walk right through the center of town?
I'm going to put you up a camel's ass - for openers.
I think I might like it.
Your fears, they make you foolish. Go to her, Jack.

[Last lines]
Sufis' rule!
[while surrounded by native Africans]
Just keep smiling. Maybe they'll think we're with National Geographic.
[At a Sufi celebration]
Look at these guys, Colton. No sheep is safe tonight.
I'm going to write the truth about you!
The truth? If I wanted the truth, I would have hired 60 Minutes.
It's looking more like 90-10, eh Kumquat?

[Jack points flair gun at F-16 Pilot]
OK, flyboy estimated time of departure is right now.

[after Ralph walks out of the catacombs into the riot taking place]
Looks like Our Lady of Mount Carmel school yard.
All right!, If we get out of this alive, I'm going to kill you. Let's go, come on!
[Ralph comes face-to-face with Omar]
Who are you?
Where's Al Jewelhala buried?
I said, who the hell are you?
Hey, don't provoke me, pal! I've had a tough day here! You know how hot it is around here? It's 120 degrees in the shade! I'm like this with Weinberger! We'll be all over you like a cheap suit!
[the captive Ralph is being dragged across the desert floor by the Sufis]

[to himself]
Oh, please. Let me get out of this alive. I swear to God, I'll be a good boy from tomorrow on.
[Ralph and the rest of the Sufis see the smoke in the distance from the burning F-16 which was stolen by Jack]
But tonight, I gotta kill Colton!
[Jack, Joan and the Jewel are under fire from Omar's soldiers]
Okay, now let's go.

[refering to the Jewel]
Wait a minute, Jack. He's coming with us.
Don't start with me, Joan! I've come halfway across Africa to rescue you!
Resuce me? I was doing fine without you!

[to Jack]
Please, I am guide. I can help you.
I don't need a guide! I need a miracle!
Why does everything got to be your way?
My way? It wasn't my idea to take off and sail around the world with you on your boat for the last six months!
I like this. You talk to each other like this often?

[to the Jewel]
Well, let me tell you what I had to put up. Three months ago, we're moored off the Canary Islands, midnight, sound asleep. A boat of three crazed Joan Wilder fans decide that they want the anchor of the Angeline for a souvenir! We were drifting for days!
Well, do you remember the incident at Gibraltar, Jack?
Oh, come on. Not that again.
He has to meet me at the governor's mansion for a formal dinner, and you show up with the entire Italian National League Basketball team!
Hey, they were hungry.

[happily, as they run from assassin's bullets]
Are we *jogging*?

[panting]
We are jogging!
What the hell are you talkin' about? I don't even know who the hell you are!
You must come with me to help find the Jewel.

[face lights up]
Jewel? What jewel?
The Jewel of the Nile. Our most pricess Jewel. Omar stole my people's Jewel. Omar is a very bad man.
Yeah, that scum, I spit on him! Jack... buddy? Let's help this nice man get his jewel back.
Yes... yes?
Here, I don't know where you're from or what you're on, but I'm sailing my boat tonight.
No! You must come to help find the Jewel now! Before Omar kill many people! As long as Omar have the Jewel... nothing can stop him.
Look, I'm going on the boat. You guys can do what you want.
[behind Jack, his sailboat blows up; Jack slowly turns around looking stunned while both Tarak and Ralph are stunned as well]
The boat blew up.
My boat blew up?
The boat blew up!
Everything's gone.
Who are you? The prince of darkness? Don't you got any friends?
If you don't tell me what the hell is going on around here, I am going to be on the first plane back to New York!
It's impossible. Tomorrow we journey to Kadhir where the following night I will proclaim myself Emperor of the Nile. You must be there with me. It will be your most important chapter.
I can't write this book if you keep secrets from me.
What secrets?
Al Jewehalla.
[Omar suddenly flinches and faces Joan]

[alarmed tone]
Where did you hear that?
Never mind. What is the Jewel?

[resumes speaking in a pleasant tone]
The Jewel is a legend. I am real. Do not be distracted from your mission, Joan Wilder. Relax. Make yourself comfortable. You stay here with me until our book is done.

[incredilous]
What? You have no right to keep me here against my will!

Then go. You're free to leave. Should you leave, I will not stop you... but I will not provide transportation to any airport, train station or port for you. Besides, only the worst kind of fool will attempt to cross our desert alone.
